main event: On January 16, 1958, a metallic, disc-shaped object was observed and photographed by the crew of the Brazilian Navy ship Almirante Saldanha hovering over Trinidade Island at an estimated altitude of 2,000 feet.
interesting points: The photographs taken by the crew were analyzed and found to be authentic and undoctored, leading to the conclusion that some type of unusual aerial object was present over Trinidade Island.
The photographs were taken by a Brazilian Navy photographer, Lt. Jose Teobaldo Viegas, and the object was described as metallic, circular in shape, and about 40 feet in diameter.
The object did not make any horizontal movement during the observation period but remained stationary over the center of the island for approximately 4 minutes.
Personnel of the Brazilian Navy's Hydrographic and Navigation Service, who were stationed on the island, also observed the object's departure from the island.
The incident received considerable interest and was widely reported in the Brazilian press, with the Brazilian Air Force carefully analyzing the photographs and eyewitness accounts.
sighted object: metallic, disc-shaped object hovering over Trinidade Island
witnesses: crew of the Brazilian Navy ship Almirante Saldanha, personnel of the Brazilian Navy's Hydrographic and Navigation Service
